content: k59 k2tog to decrease by 1 stitch k59 sm * k1 p1 repeat from * 5 times k1 complete outer border next row * k1 p1 repeat from * across to last stitch k1 seed stitch repeat the seed stitch row above for 18 more row or 2 5 inches to match the starting outer border width cast off loosely finishing weave in any ends using the yarn needle block to desired shape you may need to stretch slightly to flatten the stockinette sections but don t over-stretch be mindful of keeping the borders straight and even throughout the piece size adjustments the pattern can be modified by adding stitches and row to the borders to make them wider just make the adjustments such that the top bottom and side borders are all the same depth to maintain the quilt feel of the piece additional blocks or row of blocks can be added to the center panel though my recommendation is to keep the number of blocks in a row to an odd number adding 2 at a time if you do block sizes can also be modified if you like i think a larger number of smaller blocks would be attractive as well as larger ones just adjust the total stitch count to accommodate any changes you make 3 of 4 easy knitted baby quilt by mary lee miller © 2023 stitch block layout slip_stitch seed stitch s stockinette r reverse stockinette i think the blanket is just as nice on the wrong side so it ends up being reversible 4 of 4 easy knitted baby quilt by mary lee miller © 2023
